186029954.review:
Game is actually pretty fun if you play on the heroic servers and take your time. People complain about the micro-transactions but that's because they want all the cool little fashions, gacha gambling or whatever special pets they're selling.

Over 700 hours and I haven't spent a dime on this game. The heroic servers are completely free, everything costs mesos (cubes, character slots, inventory/storage expansion, etc.) or points you get from killing bosses (pet snack for 3 pets, 3 pets, etc).

Obviously Nexon can do better, but the game is still free if you choose it to be.

185911536.review:
From the lying about droprates to the need to play this game constantly every day to be even viable to play the major parts of the game, MS already has all the negative markers of MMOs.

Yet even the game is unredeemable. The gameplay is uninspiring, providing nothing of entertainment, resembling much more of a cookie clicker for the majority of the gameplay, and only really needing you to time a couple things in the most difficult parts. The most difficult and complex parts of the game can only be compared to the most average gameplay of undertale, or any indie game (especially considering how much money Nexon makes…).

At least one must enjoy looking at the game, right? No. Maplestory’s little development put into the actual game translates to the fidelity of a subpar game released in early 2000’s that somehow survived this long (often through sunken cost). Notifications, damage numbers, hurt and hitboxes, they all are overlapping and unoptimized creating for a low graphical fidelity experience that even some of the most dedicated casual players would struggle with. 

And that is not even on the graphics. The chibi art style is, in my personal opinion, not doing any favors. Added with the low quality art style where the pixels are visible, it has the graphics for what should not be one of the top mmos in this age. **My qualms with the graphics are personal opinions and distaste, and if you enjoy the chibi and pixelated art style, then all power to you. However, all the other points about the game are independent and should still stand with anyone**

185740276.review:
Whatever this game is trying to be, it's not fun. You just enter random events and constantly level up your characters to outrageous levels.
Either you choose Heroic or Regular, you end up leveling your character in seconds up to 200, or atleast 100+.

There are like 40 jobs, but half of them are preset characters with their own lore and story. What's the point?

Classes don't really feel very different between one another except for some gimmicky characters.

Mayhap I was expecting a different game and this one isn't for me, but sorry, this is some very weird garbage. At this point it could have autoplay and it would be the exact same of all the other 100+ mobile MMOs on the market.

185684441.review:
New player here, I personally think it's a good game. But there are massive caveats to it and Im sure alot of reviewers will mention them. I'm not technical enough to give you all the pros and cons, but Ill mention two things I personally want you to keep in mind starting in. 

Grind and Classes:
Starting out is really boring but once you start getting power everything just sorta snowballs and momentum feels like it doesn't stop once you understand enough and set goals. It's a grind fest, and it does scratch that grind itch some select players like me get alot. I like grindy games, and I know it's not for everyone.  Lots of classes, lots of variety and skill expression levels on each, sadly performance of each sadly fluctuates widely between one another. (Pet peeve: I wish we had a bit more customization on our keybinds since alot of buttons can't be changed.)

Community:
You will notice on ingame chats that alot of people dislike Nexon. The reasoning varies: a lot of people mention how the Korean version has it better when it comes to event and progression, or how the story and content are changing and retconning sometimes with questionable results. These didn't affect me as heavily as others since, again, I am new. Don't misunderstand me here, I get it, the more I learn of how things where, and how things should had been just makes me think "this game I'm playing right now could had been better". Interestingly, I actually had 0 toxic interactions so far, kinda crazy for an MMO 500+ hours in.

Would I recommend this game to you? No. While I personally like it, maybe you won't. You have to go and look at a youtube video or 2 and see what's it like. If what you see interest you, hop in and try it. 

This is not an easy game to recommend, but if you're like me, and like grindy games, then you'll find this very addictive (for better or worse? up to you.)

I'll enjoy this while it last.

185627423.review:
A fall from grace. When I was 11 or so, I used to play this game all the time. It was one of my favorites. And one of the very few online games that my parents would actually let me play.

I'm in my late 20s now, and thought that I'd hop back in to see what it's like after all this time. Let me save you the grief: it's over-produced garbage. There are so many weird classes. Not to mention the unskippable cutscenes and horrendous voice acting are extremely painful. I would go play anything else as there are TONS of options out there. This game is NOT what it used to be. A hollow shadow of its former self.

184177568.review: Playing MapleStory changed my life by introducing me to a vibrant, supportive community and teaching me the value of teamwork and persistence. Through countless hours of leveling up, exploring fantastical worlds, and conquering challenges with friends, I developed stronger social skills, made lifelong connections, and learned how to set and achieve goals. The game's nostalgic charm also gave me a safe space to escape, reflect, and grow during challenging times. It's more than a game—it's a part of my story.

183657320.review:
MapleStory is a beloved 2D side-scrolling MMORPG that has stood the test of time, and for good reason. The game offers a vast and colorful world full of quirky characters, exciting quests, and a variety of engaging gameplay mechanics. The level-up system is rewarding, with plenty of character customization options and a wide range of classes to choose from.

The combat is fast-paced and satisfying, with fluid animations and plenty of skills to unlock as you progress. Whether you’re grinding through dungeons, completing quests, or teaming up with friends for boss battles, there’s always something to keep you busy. MapleStory also offers a huge amount of content through regular updates, ensuring that there’s always something new to explore.

While the game’s free-to-play model can be a bit grind-heavy at times, the sense of progression and community makes it well worth the investment of time. It’s a fun, nostalgic MMORPG that has something for everyone, whether you’re a casual player or looking for an in-depth RPG experience.
